title: NYT Sheriff not often investigated
text: NEWSIn Mississippi, sheriffs are not often investigatedThe new Itawamba County Justice Complex remains under construction in Fulton, Miss. on Dec. 21, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe Simpson County Courthouse looms over downtown Mendenhall, Miss. on Dec. 20, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoylePhotos of former sheriffs remain in the lobby entrance of the Tunica County Justice Complex in Tunica, Miss. on Dec. 22, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleDebris remains at the entrance of the former Itawamba County Jail in downtown Fulton, Miss. on Dec. 21, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe former Itawamba County Jail remains in downtown Fulton, Miss. on Dec. 21, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe Itawamba County Courthouse remains the town center of Fulton, Miss. on Dec. 21, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe Simpson County Courthouse is reflected in a downtown window in Mendenhall, Miss. on Dec. 20, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleA pedestrian walks by a Confederate monument outside the Clarke County Courthouse in Quitman, Miss. on Dec. 20, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe Simpson County Jail remains next to a cemetery in Mendenhall, Miss. on Dec. 20, 2023.Rory Doyle For The New York Times, Rory DoyleThe Simpson
